radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix has the appearance of a thickened wall, measures up to 9 mm in diameter and has faint surrounding fat stranding. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands show normal size and attenuation without focal lesions. The kidneys are of normal size with no evidence of focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis. The gastrointestinal tract is unremarkable, and no free fluid is noted in the pelvis. Multiple scattered but not enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes are likely reactive.
